item.title: 100件事挑战 --- The 100 Thing Challenge
item.description: While resetting my life, I got rid of most of my possessions and without even realising I passed the 100 Thing Challenge. I love what Ronan wrote about “not owning shit”. 在重新安排我的生活时，我扔掉了大部分财产，甚至没有意识到我通过

item.title: 我从100天的航运中学到了什么 --- What I learnt from 100 days of shipping
item.description: About a year ago, I met @andreyazimov in Dojo, a coworking space in Bali. He wanted to make web products like me too. So I gave him some tips some time. I started a Telegram chat group with him and my brother, who was also learning web dev. Then more friends from Bali: @oskarth and @flowen_nl joined. Then I invited Marc: the founder of BetaList and a friend who I

item.title: 将副业项目转化为盈利的创业公司 --- Turning side projects into profitable startups
item.description: I just did a presentation at Dojo, a coworking space in Canggu, Bali about how to build a side project and turn it into a profitable startup. Thanks to @marcantoinefon for recording it! Over a year ago, I did a similar presentation. But since then I learnt a lot of new stuff that I’d like to talk about. A lot of this is covered more in-depth in my

item.title: 唯一真实的验证是人们为你的产品付费 --- The only real validation is people paying for your product
item.description: I still see people think “talking to customers” works when validating an idea, but people don’t always know what they want. I think real validation of an idea happens with executing it and then people getting their credit card out and paying you for it. 我仍然看到人们认为“与客户交谈”在验证一个想法时有

item.title: 在你死后没有人会关心你，宇宙也会自我毁灭 --- Nobody cares about you after you're dead and the universe destroys itself
item.description: Anne-Laure wrote about having time anxiety: Anne-Laure写道： I suffer from time anxiety. 我有时间焦虑症。 Writing this article was cathartic. 😌 写这篇文章是一种宣泄。😌 ⏳Why we obsess over spending our time in the most meaningful way 为什么我们

item.title: 24-2-29在未来，编写实际代码将像使用专业数码单反相机，而没有代码将像使用智能手机相机 --- In the future writing actual code will be like using a pro DSLR camera, and no code will be like using a smartphone camera
item.description: In the future writing actual code will be like using a pro DSLR camera, and no code will be like using a smartphone camera. Some pros will keep doing work with DSLRs (and need them), but most basic apps will be built with no code. Just like most photos now are shot on a phone. 在未来，编写实际代码将像使用专

item.title: ps怎么让图片局部半透明-百度经验
item.description: 添加白色图层，设置透明度

item.title: 为什么我联系不上也许你也应该联系不上 --- Why I'm unreachable and maybe you should be too
item.description: You may have noticed it’s practically impossible to contact me. I did that on purpose so I can spend my time how I want to spend it. I don’t really use email and I have my private message inboxes on every platform closed. And they have been like that for years. 你可能已经注意到，几乎不可能联系到我。

item.title: 远程工作人员的迁移（远程构建Podcast） --- Relocation of remote workers (Building Remotely Podcast)
item.description: I went on the Building Remotely podcast with Sondre Rasch to discuss Rebase, my immigration service that helps people move to new places that are trying to attract remote workers. 我和Sondre Rasch一起参加了Building Remotely播客，讨论了

item.title: 自助，搬到葡萄牙并建立Rebase（Wannabe Entrepreneur Podcast） --- Bootstrapping, moving to Portugal and setting up Rebase (Wannabe Entrepreneur Podcast)
item.description: Tiago from Wannabe Entrepreneur interviewed about the origins of my bootstrapping and moving to Portugal (as he’s Portuguese) and starting Rebase. 来自Wannabe Entrepreneur的Tiago采访了我的白手起家和搬到葡萄牙的起源（因为他

item.title: 我在12个月内启动了12家初创公司 --- I'm Launching 12 Startups in 12 Months
item.description: I liked the idea of Jennifer Dewalt’s 180 websites in 180 days. However, unlike Jennifer who learned web development from scratch, I can already build stuff. My challenge is to actually finish and launch my projects. So for the next 12 months, I’ve set the goal to launch 12 startups in 12 months. 我喜欢Jenn

item.title: Web性能日历»使用HTML Web组件扩展响应式视频 --- Web Performance Calendar » Extending Responsive Video with HTML Web Components
item.description: Responsive HTML video is a web standard again, and with recent patches to Firefox (oh hey!) and Chrome that match Safari’s preexisting support, it now works across all modern browsers! That means you can use media queries for delivering your videos and potentially save your users some precious bytes. 响应式HTML视频再次成为网

item.title: 令人惊艳的1700种机械原理动态图 - 知乎
item.description: 阮德升（Đức thắng Nguyễn）是一位来自越南的工程师。自从2002年退休之后，他便一直在为机械构造制作令人惊艳的3D动画目录。

Featured 特色 Why CPU Knowledge Is No Longer Enough 为什么CPU知识不再足够 In today’s AI age, the majority of developers train in the CPU way. This knowledge has been part of our academics as well, so it’s obvious to think and problem-solve in a CPU-oriented way. 在当今的AI时代，大多数开发

I was a guest on the Life Done Differently podcast with Neil Witten. I know him because he acquired Sheet2Site from my friend Andrey. I really enjoyed being on their podcast as it went way beyond the standard startup questions and delved more into life and philosophy of why we do what we do. I hope you enjoy it! 我是尼尔维滕的《生活的

It’s been almost a decade now that we’ve all been promoting the benefits of remote work and location independent living. 近十年来，我们一直在宣传远程工作和独立生活的好处。 With the pandemic suddenly shooting remote work into the mainstream, it seems like people are finally starting to believe the merits of remote work. Most

After 4 years I finally got back on the Indie Hackers podcast. The last time, back in in 2018, time was very different. It was 2 years before COVID started, remote work was still quite fringe (especially outside of the tech/startup scene). Nomad List made “just” $15k/mo and Remote OK $5k/mo. My idea was remote work would go mainstream in 2035. Then COVID happened and everything changed. 4年后

Great bit by tsunamifury on Hacker News: Hacker News上的Tsunamifury： Most people fail, most projects go unfinished, most beyond that never make enough money to sustain a company. 大多数人都失败了，大多数项目都没有完成，大多数人都没

For my music channels on YouTube I receive music and video submissions daily. They’re mostly from unknown musicians and you never know when you’re going to find a great new artist. I always browse through the submissions and see if there’s any good stuff I could feature on my channel. 对于我

After I released my drum & bass album back in 2008, I took a long timeout from writing music. I had delivered this huge project with 12 tracks where I did everything myself. I had an amazing time doing the album and independently releasing it was a crazy experience.
